Reviewer_1;Author;1;1;0;"This is a well-written paper with a large sample of girls that replicates and extends important research
on relational aggression. The focus on the functions (reactive and proactive) of relational aggression has
significant implications for intervention with adolescent girls. I commend the authors for this timely and
crucial study on factors that influence the development of aggression and antisocial behavior in girls
which is typically an understudied topic."
Reviewer_2;Author;1;1;0;There are two areas to address to strengthen the paper a bit more.
Reviewer_2;Author;1;2;0;"First
column2: it is recommended that the

column1: authors provide more information about the selection of the cluster solution. That is
column2: no information is

column1: available in the present manuscript about alternative cluster solutions from the analysis
column2: for example

column1: extent to which BIC and the silhouette coefficient differed for other solutions and so forth. It would help
the reader to have some information available as a way of arguing more strongly that the accepted
solution (which does make theoretical and empirical sense) is the strongest grouping."
Reviewer_2;Author;1;3;0;"Second
column2: the manuscript should be carefully edited as there are a fair number of grammatical and

column2: both referring to the same measure - CU traits)
